name: nytimes
text: Evening Briefing: Here's what you need to know at the end of the day https://t.co/80Qt6vJJkU

name: nytimes
text: Senator Lisa Murkowski, Republican of Alaska, said that she endorsed scathing criticism of President Trump’s leadership by Jim Mattis, the former secretary of defense, and was grappling with whether to support the president in the coming election https://t.co/RzUFmuwf5d

name: nytimes
text: The New York Times acknowledged that an Op-Ed by Sen. Tom Cotton fell short of its standards and that the editing process was “rushed." The statement came after A. G. Sulzberger, the publisher, and James Bennet, the opinion editor, had defended the essay. https://t.co/jSvaU7fQBb

name: nytimes
text:
RT @cliffordlevy: NEW YORK CITY!
https://t.co/le7Gv9vP8k https://t.co/sb7FakXogr

name: nytimes
text:
RT @migold: We have @NYTMetro reporters seeing dozens of arrests of protesters with no provocation, for the second night in a row.

We have reports of officers charging at protesters with batons, hours after the governor said "they don't do that." https://t.co/uPrPZn6ZgM

name: nytimes
text: A 23-year-old art teacher was thrilled to see his city at the fore of a nationwide event. “I’m proud to call myself a New Yorker,” he said. “This is everyone’s city.” https://t.co/5yQVE6sJsI

name: nytimes
text:
Watch as New York City police officers began arresting protesters in Manhattan about 30 minutes after the city’s 8 p.m. curfew began Thursday.

Elsewhere, police surrounded a group of protesters in the Bronx, then charged at them. Read the latest. https://t.co/qdvQMsy8xa https://t.co/98mmvVACJe

name: nytimes
text: Correction: An earlier tweet incorrectly referred to DVDs as a tool the CDC uses to back up information. Though the agency is in the midst of an effort to modernize its network and move to cloud computing, it does not use DVDs as a storage system. https://t.co/wm9sVjjmlz

name: nytimes
text:
RT @carolrosenberg: Big News: A military judge ruled today that war court judges have the power to reduce the prison sentence of a Qaeda operative at Guantánamo Bay, as a remedy for torture by the CIA. 
Whether to do it, is to be decided at sentencing.  Story, ruling. https://t.co/ACnj7VFuJ0

name: nytimes
text: “We’re not leaving.” A storm tore through Washington, D.C., as protesters gathered for another night of demonstrations on Thursday. https://t.co/p5YvwxRcBi https://t.co/0DyCfzn3a4

name: nytimes
text:
RT @reidepstein: NEW: Joe Biden during tonight's livestream: “There are probably anywhere from 10 to 15 percent of the people out there that are just not very good people." 

https://t.co/kb8LKRsxBm

name: nytimes
text:
Approval of President Trump is slipping where he can’t afford to lose it — among evangelical voters
https://t.co/vk2bPIk74e

name: nytimes
text:
What happened before David McAtee was fatally shot by the police in Louisville, Kentucky, on June 1?

We analyzed surveillance footage and bystander video to show how the incident unfolded — and how questionable policing tactics played a role. https://t.co/zeHBmPgybb

name: nytimes
text:
Two police officers in Buffalo, New York, were suspended after shoving a protester in this incident that was caught on video. An official said the man was hospitalized with a head injury.

The video contains vulgarity and disturbing images. https://t.co/A2Q92yP65q https://t.co/DXq54eDZN8

name: nytimes
text: RT @jamiestockwell: The three officers charged with aiding and abetting #DerekChauvin in the death of #GeorgeFloyd appear to have crossed the blue wall of silence, with two of them blaming #DerekChauvin and the third cooperating with investigators: https://t.co/JF5vYsgcel

name: nytimes
text: A local news report said protesters challenged the L.A. police chief for suggesting looters were somewhat responsible for George Floyd’s death. He apologized to the crowd and asked, “Will you accept my apology?” Some people in the crowd shouted, “No.” https://t.co/Jc51AtEny8

name: nytimes
text: Chinese hackers are targeting the personal email accounts of campaign staff members working for former Vice President Joe Biden, Google said, while confirming previous reports that Iran has targeted President Trump’s campaign https://t.co/1OlfM2aVpz

name: nytimes
text: RT @jeligon: Louisville Police say they fatally shot David McAtee because he shot at them. That's misleading, according to this @malachybrowne video investigation. Officers 1st violated dept policy by firing pepper balls at McAtee & others who were doing nothing wrong https://t.co/WdJ0ziPJvf

name: nytimes
text: Video circulated of New York police officers arresting a delivery worker on Thursday night, despite regulations that allow essential workers to continue working after curfew. Mayor Bill de Blasio tweeted that the arrest was “NOT acceptable." https://t.co/5ykDjqkO8h

name: nytimes
text: This was the scene in the Bronx shortly after the 8 p.m. curfew on Thursday, as New York City police pinned in peaceful protesters and charged them with batons, arresting dozens. https://t.co/yz8phfIK5A https://t.co/4WDmPyHnqQ

name: nytimes
text: RT @nytimesworld: Experts say the recent attacks reflect a growing pattern of anti-press violence in the United States. Pauline Adès-Mével, a spokeswoman for Reporters Without Borders, said the frequency and the intensity of the U.S. attacks are “shocking.” https://t.co/eh6okejjCG

name: nytimes
text: Globally, known cases of the coronavirus are growing faster than ever with more than 100,000 new ones a day. The surge is concentrated in densely populated, low- and middle-income countries across the Middle East, Latin America, Africa and South Asia. https://t.co/MzbErVaqTf

name: nytimes
text: 6 members of a military family, including 4 young children, were found dead in their car in the family’s garage in San Antonio, apparently after suffering from intentional carbon monoxide poisoning, the police said https://t.co/NjOvhBkkM1

name: nytimes
text: Europe morning briefing: Here's what you need to know to start your day https://t.co/NujQCpUQWE

name: nytimes
text:
New revelations in the 2007 disappearance of 3-year-old Madeleine McCann have put the case back in the spotlight
https://t.co/6euxQDRnpf

name: nytimes
text: Geneticists have turned up intriguing links between DNA and the coronavirus. Patients with Type A blood, for example, seem to be at greater risk. https://t.co/WN47bUzHQa

name: nytimes
text:
If AstraZeneca’s vaccine is approved, an Indian manufacturer has agreed to make at least a billion doses for distribution to low- and middle-income countries.

Live updates about the coronavirus pandemic: https://t.co/fJ00D22hL4

name: nytimes
text: Attacks against journalists covering demonstrations against racial injustice have prompted foreign governments to call on American authorities to respect press freedom and protect reporters. For the United States, it is a role reversal. https://t.co/27M8rdXNuM

name: nytimes
text: Tourist trails helped push elephants to their deaths in Thailand’s oldest nature preserve. The coronavirus lockdown is allowing them to roam freely again. https://t.co/xR02v87iwo
